text: William Arthur Coles, from the University of California, San Diego, was awarded the status of Fellow in the American Physical Society, after they were nominated by their Topical Group in Plasma Astrophysics in 2006, for his major contributions to our understanding of the effect of plasma turbulence on radio wave propagation, and the use of radio propagation measurements to infer properties of remote turbulent plasmas in interplanetary space and the interstellar medium. == References == ==External links== *Jacob's School of Engineering biography Category:Fellows of the American Physical Society Category:American physicists Category:Living people Category:Year of birth missing (living people)
title: William Arthur Coles
